table.name: mem
table.column: See under {QIch wab Ho'DoS:n} for the names of the Klingon consonants and vowels.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a device that receives (but does not send) an audio signal. For the device used for two-way communication, see {Se' HablI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for a broadcaster, radio service, etc. It can also be used for the device that does the transmitting. If a distinction must be made, the device is {wab labwI' jan:n@@wab labwI':n, jan:n:1}.
Dies kann gleichzeitig der Radiosender an sich sein, oder auch das sendende Gerät. Um zu unterscheiden, ist das Gerät {wab labwI' jan:n@@wab labwI':n, jan:n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to sounds, not to letters or glyphs.
Beschreibt den Ton, nicht den Buchstaben oder ein Symbol.
این مربوط به صداها است ، نه به حروف یا گلایف ها. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser ljud, inte bokstäver eller glyfer. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к звукам, а не к буквам или глифам. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指聲音，而不是字母或字形。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere a sons, não a letras ou glifos. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to sounds, not to letters or glyphs.
Beschreibt den Ton, nicht den Buchstaben oder ein Symbol.
این مربوط به صداها است ، نه به حروف یا گلایف ها. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser ljud, inte bokstäver eller glyfer. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к звукам, а не к буквам или глифам. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指聲音，而不是字母或字形。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere a sons, não a letras ou glifos. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: As a spelling convention, {wab Do:n:nolink} "speed of sound" is written as two words. When used as a measurement term ("Mach"), it is written as one word ({wabDo:n:nolink}). The pronunciation (and, for that matter, the meaning) is the same.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a more general meaning of {waH:v:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a specialized meaning of {waH:v:1}. It means to try out food to see if it's been properly prepared or to determine if one likes it.[2]
Do not confuse this with {mum:v}, which means "taste" in the sense of perceiving flavors.

table.name: mem
table.column: vibrate, be in a state of vibration
vibrar, estar em um estado de vibração
This means to move in a fast repetitive way, like a guitar string.
Dies bedeutet sich sehr schnell hin und her bewegen, wie eine Gitarrensaite
این به معنی حرکت سریع و تکراری مانند یک رشته گیتار است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta betyder att röra sig på ett snabbt repetitivt sätt, som en gitarrsträng. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это означает, что нужно двигаться быстро, повторяющимся образом, как гитарная струна. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這意味著要像吉他弦那樣快速重複地移動。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso significa mover-se de uma maneira rápida e repetitiva, como uma corda de violão. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is meat prepared with {ngat:n:2}. The word for the specific meat replaces the word {Ha'DIbaH:n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This sounds like the Chinese word for "crooked" (彎).

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an Indo-European root "wanha" with exactly this meaning.

table.name: mem
table.column: To express natural phenomena, the name for the effect is followed by the word {wanI':n:nolink}.[2]
This word was defined in {TKD:src} as "phenomenon, event, occurrence". The definition "effect" was added in the booklet for the {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2016:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: You can certainly "wack" someone with it, or "walk" in it.

table.name: mem
table.column: en slags fågel (med en väldigt lång näbb)
This is a bird with a very long beak.
Dies ist ein Vogel mit einem sehr langen Schnabel. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این پرنده ای است با منقار بسیار طولانی. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en fågel med en mycket lång näbb. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это птица с очень длинным клювом. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um pássaro com bico muito longo. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Kiwi is a brand of shoe polish ({waq:n} "shoe", {boch:v} "be shiny"), and also a kind of bird with a very long beak.

table.name: mem
table.column: ستون (در یک جدول یا صفحه گسترده) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
kolumn (i en tabell eller ett kalkylblad) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
列（在表格或電子表格中） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
From the term "warp and weft" in weaving. See also {wev:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: type of knife (used for food preparation)
نوع چاقو (برای تهیه غذا استفاده می شود) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
刀的類型（用於食物準備） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
tipo de faca (usada para preparação de alimentos)
This is large, sharp, and square-bladed, almost like an {'obmaQ:n}.
This is a reference to Ward and June Cleaver, from the television show "Leave It to Beaver". See {tlher:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that this means "be amiss, awry" (something has gone wrong or didn't turn out according to plan), as opposed to {muj:v} "be incorrect, factually wrong".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to lubricant generally, and not to a specific type of lubricant.
Dies bezieht sich allgemein auf Schmiermittel und nicht auf eine bestimmte Art von Schmiermittel. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به طور کلی به روان کننده و نه به نوع خاصی از روان کننده اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser generellt smörjmedel och inte till en specifik typ av smörjmedel. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к смазке в целом, а не к конкретному типу смазки. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這通常是指潤滑劑，而不是特定類型的潤滑劑。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se geralmente ao lubrificante, e não a um tipo específico de lubrificante. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: For the mathematical operation of division, see {boqHa''egh:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: "The White Stripes" was an American rock band.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a situation of disorganization.
Dies bezieht sich auf eine Desorganisationssituation. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به وضعیت بی نظمی اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta hänvisar till en situation med desorganisering. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere a uma situação de desorganização. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"Wire". Perhaps a reference to the mess of cables often connecting certain groups of devices.

table.name: mem
table.column: In {Klingon Monopoly:src}, {Quj wa'DIch:n:nolink} is used to refer to the original Monopoly game. So {wa'DIch:n:nolink} can be used for "original" in the sense of "the first" (see under {qa':v} for the sentence).

table.name: mem
table.column: We succeed together in a greater whole.
Wir haben Erfolg als Teile eines großen Ganzen.
ما در کل بزرگتر می شویم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Vi lyckas tillsammans i en större helhet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Мы преуспеваем вместе в большом целом. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
我們在更大的整體上共同取得成功。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Konzentriere dich auf ein einziges Ziel.

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "we hit one target". It can be shortened to just {DoS wIqIp.:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: wa' jaj 'etlh 'uchchoHlaH tlhIngan puqloD; jajvetlh loD nen moj.
The son of a Klingon is a man the day he can first hold a blade.
Der Sohn eines Klingonen ist ein Mann sobald er ein Schwert halten kann.
پسر کلینگان روزی است که او می تواند اولین تیغه را نگه دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Klingons son är en man dagen han först kan hålla ett blad. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Сын клингона - это человек, который в первый день может держать клинок. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
克林崗的兒子是他可以先拿刀片的那一天。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O filho de um klingon é um homem no dia em que pode segurar uma lâmina pela primeira vez.

table.name: mem
table.column: For one mission, there is one leader.
Für eine Mission gibt es einen Führer.
برای یک ماموریت، یک رهبر وجود دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
För ett uppdrag finns en ledare. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
На одну миссию есть один лидер. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
一個任務只有一個領導者。
Para uma missão, há um líder.

table.name: mem
table.column: wa' SuvwI' muHlu'DI', tuHchoH Hoch SuvwI'pu'.
The execution of but one warrior brings shame to all.
Die Hinrichtung eines einzigen Kriegers bringt Schande über alle.
اعدام اما یکی از جنگجویان همه را شرمنده می کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Utförandet av en enda krigare ger skam till alla. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The execution of but one warrior brings shame to all. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
只有一個戰士的執行給所有人帶來了恥辱。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A execução de apenas um guerreiro traz vergonha a todos.

table.name: mem
table.column: Maltz said that if, in school, a student responded to a teacher's question by saying this, the student was likely to be disciplined (unless that was actually the correct answer). He didn't elaborate further.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Kill one of them. I don't care which.
یکی از آنها را بکشید من اهمیتی نمی دهم که [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Döda en av dem. Jag bryr mig inte om vilken. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Убей одного из них. Мне все равно, какие. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Mate um deles. Eu não ligo para qual.

table.name: mem
table.column: wa'maH cha' pemmey wa'maH cha' rammey je

This idiomatic expression refers to an event in the life of {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}, when he fought his brother {moratlh:n:name} for twelve days and twelve nights (as recounted in the {paq'batlh:src}). The expression means not only that the length of the event is long, but also that the event is an important one, worthy of taking up so much time.

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingons consider the number 13 to be special because of the way they used to count. The decimal number 12 used to be expressed as 3 × 3 + 3, and then the system became complicated. This association remained even after Klingons switched over to the decimal number system.

Klingonen betrachten die Zahl 13 aufgrund der Art und Weise, wie sie früher gezählt haben, als etwas Besonderes. Die Dezimalzahl 12 wurde früher als 3 × 3 + 3 ausgedrückt, und dann wurde das System kompliziert. Diese Assoziation blieb auch nach der Umstellung der Klingonen auf das Dezimalzahlensystem bestehen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

کلینگون ها به دلیل روشی که قبلاً از آنها حساب می کردند ، شماره 13 را ویژه می دانند. عدد اعشاری 12 قبلاً به صورت 3 3 3 + 3 بیان می شد و سیستم پیچیده تر می شود. این انجمن حتی پس از تغییر کلینگون به سیستم عدد اعشاری باقی ماند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Klingons anser att numret 13 är speciellt på grund av hur de brukade räkna. Talstalet 12 uttrycktes tidigare som 3 × 3 + 3, och sedan blev systemet komplicerat. Denna förening förblev även efter att Klingons bytte till decimaltalssystemet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Клингоны считают число 13 особенным из-за того, как они привыкли считать. Десятичное число 12 раньше выражалось как 3 × 3 + 3, а затем система усложнялась. Эта связь сохранилась даже после того, как клингоны перешли на десятичную систему счисления. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
克林崗人認為13的數字很特殊，因為它們的計數方式。十進制數字12過去常常表示為3×3 + 3，然後系統變得複雜了。即使在克林貢族切換到十進制數字系統後，這種聯繫仍然存在。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Os klingons consideram o número 13 especial por causa do modo como costumavam contar. O número decimal 12 costumava ser expresso como 3 × 3 + 3, e então o sistema ficou complicado. Essa associação permaneceu mesmo depois que os klingons passaram para o sistema de números decimais. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
▶ {qatlh Suvbe' chaH? wa'maH wej.:sen:nolink} "Why aren't they fighting? It's complicated."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is distinct from an object's weight, which is dependent on gravitation.
Dies unterscheidet sich vom Gewicht eines Objekts, das von der Gravitation abhängt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این متفاوت از وزن یک شیء است که به گرانش بستگی دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta skiljer sig från ett objekts vikt, som är beroende av gravitation. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это отличается от веса объекта, который зависит от гравитации. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這與物體的重量不同，後者取決於重力。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é diferente do peso de um objeto, que depende da gravitação. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The kilogram was originally defined to be the mass of 1 L ({wa':n:num}, {lay:n:1}) of water.

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {The Klingon Art of War:src}, this is the name of the first Klingon god.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: vara i onåd, vara oönskad, vara utstött

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a slang meaning of {web:v:1} applied to a situation or mission or the like.
Possibly a reference to the (World Wide) Web.

table.name: mem
table.column: serve fermented food at its peak
vergorene/vergärte Lebensmittel zum richtigen Zeitpunkt servieren
غذای غنی شده را در اوج خود قرار دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
servera jäst mat när den är som bäst
在高峰期供應發酵食品 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
servir comida fermentada no tempo certo
This is food mixed with {'atlhqam:n}, fermented, and served.[1, p.92]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is like {yot:v}, but with the connotation of surprise or speed.[2]
This word is listed among other militaristic terminology in the body of {KGT:src} on p.48.

table.name: mem
table.column: A warrior fights to the death.
Ein Krieger kämpft bis zum Tod.
یک جنگجو به مرگ می پیوندد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Um guerreiro luta até a morte.

table.name: mem
table.column: جذاب (فقط به طرز عجیب و غریب) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
charmerande, just snyggt, vackert (används endast ironiskt)

table.name: mem
table.column: Either the thing owed, or the person to whom something is owed, can be the object.
Entweder die geschuldete Sache oder die Person, der etwas geschuldet wird, kann das Objekt sein. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
یا چیزی که بدهکار است ، یا شخصی که چیزی به او بدهکار است می تواند موضوع باشد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Antingen är den skyldiga saken eller personen som något är skyldigt kan vara föremålet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Объектом может быть либо вещь, которая должна, либо человек, которому что-то должен. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
所欠的東西或所欠的人都可以成為對象。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Ou a coisa devida, ou a pessoa a quem algo é devido, pode ser o objeto. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
In English slang, to "welch" is to fail to pay a debt or to fulfill an obligation.

▶ {qawel:sen:nolink} "I owe you"[1; 3] ▶ {voHDajbo' wellu' 100:sen:nolink} "mortgaged for 100"[2] ▶ {yervamvaD voHDajbo' wellu'chugh, 'echletHom Dopvam yIcha'.:sen:nolink} "Card must be turned this side up if property is mortgaged."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The stereotypical {targh:n:nolink} makes a sound conventionally rendered {welwelwel:sen:nolink} (where the number of repetitions is variable).
Der typische {targh:n:nolink} macht ein Geräusch, das man meist als {welwelwel:sen:nolink} nachmacht (Die Häufigkeit der Silbe ist variabel).

{wel:v} is "owe" so {welwelwel:excl:nolink} is "oweoweowe". "Wowowow" is one way to transliterate the sound a dog makes in English.
"Well Well Well" is a song by John Lennon in which he screams the song's title. "Well, well, well" is also a stereotypical phrase associated with British police officers in film.

table.name: mem
table.column: kränka, bryta emot, överträda, störa, skända

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has this meaning in the {voSpegh Sep:n} dialect.

table.name: mem
table.column: ضربه (ابزار کوبه ای) با کف دست [AUTOTRANSLATED]
golpear (instrumento de percussão) com a palma da mão

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the closest thing Klingons have to the "World Wide Web".
Dies ist das, was Klingonen dem "World Wide Web" am nächsten kommen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این نزدیکترین چیزی است که کلینگونها به "شبکه جهانی وب" دارند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Det här är det närmaste Klingons har "World Wide Web". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это самое близкое, что есть у клингонов во «всемирной паутине». [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是Klingons與“萬維網”最接近的東西。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é a coisa mais próxima que os klingons têm da "World Wide Web". [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: lose, undergo a reduction of, suffer a reduction of
از دست دادن، کاهش، رنج می برند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
förlora, genomgå en minskning av, drabbas av en minskning av [AUTOTRANSLATED]
lose, undergo a reduction of, suffer a reduction of [AUTOTRANSLATED]
perder, sofrer uma redução de, sofrer uma redução de

To say that someone has died, just use {Hegh:v}. Using {weS:v:nolink} implies that someone is lost, i.e., gone or missing, or severely injured and not expected to return (or to return anytime soon), but not necessarily dead.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used for textiles or fabric in clothing, sheets, towels, and so on, but generally not for carpets or rugs (except for thin ones).[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: A {weSjech ba'Suq:n@@weSjech:n, ba'Suq:n} is a particular sort of balloon. Once a basket (an {'unwat:n}, or in this case, an {'unwat'a':n@@'unwat:n, -'a':n}) is attached to it, the whole thing might be called a {weSjech ba'Suq Duj:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ردیف (در یک جدول یا صفحه گسترده) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
rad (i en tabell eller ett kalkylblad) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
行（在表格或電子表格中） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
linha (em uma tabela ou planilha de cálculo)

Besides being used for a row in a grid (as in a spreadsheet or other graphic representation), this can also be used for physical things if the overall configuration is (or might be) grid-like and there are (or might be) other rows, not just one. For example, this would be used for rows of corn or rows of trees growing in a field on a farm. It could still be used if there's only one row in a situation where typically there are more (or it wouldn't be surprising if there were more). If it's unclear in a situation whether more than one row is expected or typical, {wIyqap:n:nolink} is probably the right choice.
The word {mIr:n:1} can be used as a slang term for this, if things are clear.

From the term "warp and weft" in weaving. See also {war:n}.
This was originally defined as "row (in a table or spreadsheet)" at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2015:src} but was expanded to include physical things later.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The object is the image that's drawn. The notion is that it's a quick drawing, not a careful one.
This word does not have the connotation of the English word "doodle" that the person doing the doodling is not paying attention to what is being drawn or sketched.
If the result of the doodling is not easily identifiable or nameable, the "picture" can be called a {yay:n:3}.
While the implemented used could be anything, it is not common to use this verb with a {rItlh naQ:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a ship's full complement of personnel, crew plus officers.
Dies ist die vollständige Besetzung eines Schiffes mit Personal, Besatzung und Offizieren. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این یک مکمل کامل از پرسنل ، خدمه به علاوه افسران است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är ett fartygs kompletta komplement av personal, besättning plus officerare. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это полный комплект корабельного персонала, экипажа и офицеров. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是船舶人員，船員和高級職員的完整補充。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é o complemento completo de pessoal, tripulação e oficiais de um navio. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
{maH:n:1h}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n} = {wI-:v:pref,nolink}
When used with {-lu':v}, this prefix means "Someone (indefinite subject) does something to us".

table.name: mem
table.column: be sour, be bitter, be tart
vara sur, vara bitter, vara besk, vara syrlig
быть кислым, быть горьким, быть терпким
▶ {Hoch vor Dargh wIb.:sen:nolink} "Sour tea cures everything."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qaStaHvIS wa'maH puq poHmey, wo'rIv betleH ghaj qorDu'Daj. nuja' tlhIngan wIch ja'wI'pu' yIntaHvIS qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay' batlh 'etlhvam chenmoHlu'pu'.:sen:nolink} "Worf's bat'telh has been in his family for ten generations. According to Klingon legend, this sword of honor descends from the time of Kahless the Unforgettable."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The example sentence is a lip-match for {'ej DochmeywIj vItlhapqa'meH}.
▶ {'ej Dojmey wID, vInDa'ma' peq.:sen@@'ej:conj, Dojmey:n, wID:v, vInDa':n, -ma':n, peq:v} "He has killed many of our people."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {wIH; Hur'Iqngan rur@@wIH:v, Hur'Iqngan:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a set expression, and would not be understood as a real person posing as a farmer. Klingons don't use such things any more.
Dies ist ein fester Ausdruck und würde nicht als echte Person verstanden werden, die sich als Landwirt ausgibt. Klingonen benutzen solche Dinge nicht mehr. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این یک بیان کامل است و به عنوان یک فرد واقعی که به عنوان یک کشاورز مطرح می شود درک نمی شود. کلینگونها دیگر از چنین مواردی استفاده نمی کنند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är ett fast uttryck, och skulle inte förstås som en riktig person som poserar som jordbrukare. Klingons använder inte sådana saker längre. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это заданное выражение, и его нельзя понимать как реального человека, изображающего из себя фермера. Клингоны больше не используют такие вещи. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一個固定的表達方式，不會被理解為冒充農民的真實人物。克林崗人不再使用這些東西。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é uma expressão definida e não seria entendida como uma pessoa real se passando por um agricultor. Os klingons não usam mais essas coisas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an expression used between close friends in the higher social classes. It should be avoided if possible, unless one's social standing is absolutely clear.

Dies ist ein Ausdruck, der zwischen engen Freunden in den höheren sozialen Schichten verwendet wird. Es sollte nach Möglichkeit vermieden werden, es sei denn, die soziale Stellung ist absolut klar. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این عبارتی است که بین دوستان نزدیک در طبقات بالاتر اجتماعی به کار رفته است. در صورت امکان باید از آن اجتناب کرد ، مگر اینکه از جایگاه اجتماعی فرد کاملاً مشخص باشد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är ett uttryck som används mellan nära vänner i de högre sociala klasserna. Det bör undvikas om möjligt, såvida inte ens sociala ställning är helt klar. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Это выражение используется между близкими друзьями в высших социальных слоях. Этого следует избегать, если это возможно, если только его социальное положение не является абсолютно ясным. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是較高社會階層中密友之間的一種表達方式。除非可能，否則應避免這樣做，除非一個人的社會地位絕對明確。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é uma expressão usada entre amigos íntimos nas classes sociais mais altas. Deve ser evitado, se possível, a menos que a posição social de alguém seja absolutamente clara. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The real reason {wIj jup:sen:nolink} has this meaning is because some Star Trek writer looked up "my" and "friend" in {TKD:src}, found {-wIj:n} and {jup:n}, and attached them to each other without any regard for grammar or correctness. In standard Klingon, "my friend" (assuming said friend is a being capable of language) is {jupwI':n:nolink} (from {jup:n} and {-wI':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a stand-alone spike such as a stake.
Dies bezieht sich auf eine eigenständige Spitze wie einen Einsatz. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این اشاره به سنبله مستقل مانند سهام دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta hänvisar till en fristående topp som t.ex. en insats. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к отдельному пику, такому как кол. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這指的是獨立的尖峰，例如股票。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se a um pico independente, como uma estaca. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
On the TV show "Buffy the Vampire Slayer", there is a character nicknamed Spike whose real name is William.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a double pun: it sounds like "will puke", and also refers to "Pudd'nhead Wilson" ({puqloD:n} means "son"), the name of the eponymous character of a Mark Twain novel.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a famous Klingon playwright.
Dies ist der Name eines berühmten klingonischen Dramatikers. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این نام یک نمایشنامه‌نویس معروف کلیینگون است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är namnet på en berömd Klingon dramatiker. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是著名的克林崗劇作家的名字。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é o nome de um famoso dramaturgo Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: "The Whetstone of Witte" was a famous book on mathematics, in which the equals sign (=) was introduced.

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {KGT p.99:src}, this verb may be used to describe the action of breaking off a portion of food to transfer from a serving platter ({'elpI':n}) to one's plate ({jengva':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is also used for clicking on a hyperlink on a computer.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to an abstract schematic of a battlefield, which is displayed on a {jIH:n:2}. Contrast this with {HaSta:n}.
The first ever line of Klingon spoken on-screen was {wIy cha':sen@@wIy:n, cha':v}, in {Star Trek I:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: صفحه نمایش تاکتیکی را نمایش دهید! [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/ooFuTPjRtEM}
The clipped Klingon form of this command would be {wIy cha'!:sen@@wIy:n, cha':v}
The first ever line of Klingon spoken on-screen was {wIy cha':sen:nolink}, in {Star Trek I:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: row or line (of people or things not expected to be in motion)
ردیف یا خط (از افراد یا چیزهایی که انتظار نمی رود در حرکت باشد) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
rad eller rad (av människor eller saker som inte förväntas vara i rörelse) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
строка или строка (людей или предметов, которые не должны находиться в движении) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
一行或一行（預期不會運動的人或事物） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
fila ou linha (de pessoas ou coisas que não se espera que estejam em movimento)

This might be used for a police lineup. The constituents of a {wIyqap:n:nolink} are not expected to move (in contrast to those in a {lanSoy:n:nolink}. This word is used even if the people or things are bunched up. It's also used if there is more than one line, when typically there's only one, so that in a police lineup with two rows, each is still a {wIyqap:n:nolink} (and not a {wev:n:nolink}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is not a Klingon word, but the Klingon pronunciation of a Federation Standard word, referring to a collaboratively edited website or database.
Dies ist kein klingonisches Wort, sondern die klingonische Aussprache eines Federation Standard-Wortes, das sich auf eine gemeinsam bearbeitete Website oder Datenbank bezieht. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این یک کلمه کلینگون نیست ، بلکه تلفظ کلینگون یک کلمه استاندارد فدراسیون با اشاره به یک وب سایت یا بانک اطلاعاتی ویرایش شده مشترک است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är inte ett Klingon-ord, utan Klingon-uttalet av ett Federation Standard-ord som hänvisar till en samarbetsredigerad webbplats eller databas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это не клингонское слово, а клингонское произношение стандартного слова федерации, относящееся к совместно редактируемому веб-сайту или базе данных. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這不是克林崗語單詞，而是聯邦標准單詞的克林貢語發音，指的是經過協作編輯的網站或數據庫。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta não é uma palavra klingon, mas a pronúncia klingon de uma palavra Standard da Federação, referente a um site ou banco de dados editado em colaboração. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: hurl a spear by means of a {chetvI':n:2}
hurl a spear by means of a {chetvI':n:2} [AUTOTRANSLATED]
arremessar uma lança por meio de um {chetvI':n:2}

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {cha' 'ujmo' jIH woch law' SoH woch puS:sen:nolink} "I'm two {'uj:sen:nolink}es taller than you."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: It is regrettable when this is applied to food.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: transgress, do more than is acceptable
فرار، انجام بیش از قابل قبول است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
överträda, göra mer än vad som är acceptabelt, gå för långt
transgress, do more than is acceptable [AUTOTRANSLATED]
transgredir, fazer mais do que é aceitável
{bIwogh:sen:nolink} might be translated "You go too far."

table.name: mem
table.column: ta upp, plocka upp, lyfta upp

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {labmeH 'evnagh Se' lo' tlhIngan QumwI'. janmey ngo' lulo'lu'DI' pIj jabbI'ID nISpu' woj.:sen:nolink} "A Klingon communicator sends a signal through subspace radio. Older models were susceptible to radiation."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The noun {woj:n} and the verb {Say'qu'moH:v} appeared next to each other in a word list published in {veS QonoS:src} (reprinted in {HQ 1.3, Sept. 1992:src} in Sept. 1992). Will Martin made an error in transcribing the words, and MO subsequently canonised his error, as a joke.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used for both eating and attacking by pecking.
Dieses Wort wird sowohl zum Essen als auch zum Angreifen durch Picken verwendet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این کلمه برای غذا خوردن و حمله به وسیله پک زدن استفاده می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta ord används både för att äta och attackera genom att haka. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это слово используется как для еды, так и для нападения путем клевания. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個詞用於啄食和攻擊。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta palavra é usada para comer e atacar por bicar. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is usually a narrow road or pathway between or behind buildings.
Dies ist normalerweise eine schmale Straße oder ein schmaler Weg zwischen oder hinter Gebäuden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این معمولاً یک جاده باریک یا مسیری بین ساختمان یا پشت ساختمان است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är vanligtvis en smal väg eller väg mellan eller bakom byggnader. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Обычно это узкая дорога или путь между или позади зданий. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這通常是建築物之間或建築物後的狹窄道路或小路。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Geralmente, é uma estrada ou caminho estreito entre ou atrás dos prédios. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Dr. Wonmug is a character from the comic strip Alley Oop.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that {'ol:v} is used for checking a fact, while {woq:v:nolink} is used for confirming it.
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - Magic to Make the Sanest Man Go Mad:src}

table.name: mem
mem
mem
table.column:
There is an idiom, {wov; ghI'boj Sech rur}.
This verb is also used to describe a sunny day.[2]
If one's eyes are "sensitive to light", they could be sensitive to {wovtaHghach:n@@wov:v, -taH:v, -ghach:v}.[3]
The {wovtaHghach:n:nolink} construction was used by Okrand to explain how to describe Mirror Lorca's condition in {Star Trek Discovery:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Watch the Hallmark commercial in which this word appears: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/9eM1OSNGLwI}
This word has appeared in canon only in the formation {wovmoHbogh janHommey:n:nolink}[1; 2], but the noun suffixes have been removed here for ease of reference.
▶ {Qapqu' wovmoHbogh janHommey!:sen:nolink} "It even has working lights!"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to specific memories or recollections, and is different from "memory" in the sense of the ability to remember or the power of recall, for which see {qaw:n}.
▶ {wov'on qaw:sen@@wov'on:n, qaw:v} "he/she remembers a memory", "he/she has a memory"

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: {wo' tay':n:nolink} is an older name than {tuqjIjQa':n}. The Klingons who gave the country this name might have been thinking of the British Empire.[2]
[1] {Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue:src}, [2] {KLI mailing list 2011.10.29:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: wo' toy'taHvIS Hegh 'e' tul Hoch tlhIngan.
To die while serving the Empire is the hope of every Klingon.
Im Dienste des Imperiums zu sterben ist die Hoffnung jedes Klingonen.
در حالی که خدمت امپراتوری را می کشند امید هر کلینگان است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Att dö medan du tjänar imperiet är hoppet på varje Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Умереть во время служения Империи - надежда каждого клингона. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
服務帝國時死亡是每個克林崗人的希望。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Morrer enquanto servia ao Império é a esperança de todo Klingon.

table.name: mem
table.column: The son of Mogh ({mogh:n:name}), and the first Klingon officer to serve in Starfleet. He is portrayed by the actor {mayqel Do'rIn:n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: An idiomatic way of saying "snore" in English is "saw wood".

table.name: mem
table.column: محافظت نشده باشد، آسیب پذیر باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara oskyddad, vara sårbar, vara utsatt

▶ {Dumer DIvI' QaS 'ej DuHIv, vaj bIwunchoH 'ej bIrIQchoH.:sen:nolink} "Surprise attack by Federation leaves you unprotected and damaged."[1] ▶ {DuHIv jagh Dangu'laHbe'bogh, vaj bIwunchoH 'ej bIpujchoH.:sen:nolink} "Attack by unknown enemy leaves you vulnerable and weak."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to undo a decision. Its only known use in canon is in the example.

table.name: mem
table.column: ha huvudvärk, ha ont i huvudet
The similarity of this to {wuq:v} may be a joke.

table.name: mem
table.column: این به معنای واقعی کلمه فقط به معنای "اتاق زیرزمینی" است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
從字面上看，這僅意味著“地下室”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: förlita sig på, vara beroende av, vara hänvisad till
